com.nnvmso.web
Class PlayerApiController

java.lang.Object
  com.nnvmso.web.PlayerApiController

@Controller
@RequestMapping(value="playerAPI")
public class PlayerApiController
extends java.lang.Object

This is API specification for 9x9 Player. Please note although the document is written in JavaDoc form, it is generic Web Service API via HTTP request-response, no Java necessary.

Example:

Player Request:
http://qa.9x9.tv/playerAPI/brandInfo?mso=9x9

Service response:
0 success
--
name 9x9
title 9x9.tv

In this document, method name is used as part of the URL, examples:

http://hostname:port/playerAPI/channelBrowse?category=1
http://hostname:port/playerAPI/brandInfo?mso=9x9

API categories:

Brand information: brandInfo

Account related: guestRegister, signup, login, userTokenVerify, signout

Category listing: categoryBrowse

Channel and program listing: channelLineup, programInfo

IPG action: moveChannel, channelSubmit, subscribe, unsubscribe

IPG snapshot: saveIpg, loadIpg

Data collection: pdr, programRemove

9x9 Player API always returns a string:

First line is status code and status message, separated by tab.

Different sets of data are separated by "--\n".

Data representation is \t separated of each field, \n separated of each record.

Example 1: login

0 success
--
token a466D491UaaU245P412a
name a

Example 2: categoryBrowse

0 success
--
1201 Movie 5
1203 TV 2
1204 Sports 2

Please note each api's document omits status code and status message.

Basic API flows:

The first step is to call brandInfo to retrieve brand information. It returns brand id, brand logo, and any necessary brand information.

The next step depends on the UI requirement. Use categoryBrowse to find category listing based on the brand. Or get an account first. Use userTokenVerify if there's an existing user token. If there's no token at hand, either sign up for user as a guest(guestRegister) or ask user to signup(signup).

Channel and program listing(channelLineup and programInfo) would be ready after an account is registered.

brandInfo

@RequestMapping(value="brandInfo")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.String> brandInfo(@RequestParam(value="mso",required=false)
                                                                                          java.lang.String brandName,
                                                                                          javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest req)
Get brand information.

Parameters:
mso - mso name, optional, server returns default mso 9x9 if omiited
Returns:

Data returns in key and value pair. Key and value is tab separated. Each pair is \n separated.
keys include "key", "name", logoUrl", "jingleUrl", "preferredLangCode" "debug"

Example:
0 success
--
key 1
name 9x9
title 9x9.tv
logoUrl /WEB-INF/../images/logo_9x9.png
jingleUrl /WEB-INF/../videos/opening.swf
logoClickUrl /
preferredLangCode en
debug 1

login

@RequestMapping(value="login")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.String> login(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest req,
                                                                                      javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse resp)
User login. A "user" cookie will be set.

Only POST operation is supported.

Parameters:
email - email
password - password
Returns:
If signup succeeds, the return message will be

preference1 key name (tab) preference1 value (\n)
preference2 key name (tab) preference2 value (\n)
preferences.....

Example:
0 success
--
token QQl0l208W2C4F008980F
name c
lastLogin 1300822489194

user - user's unique identifier
channel - channelId

Returns:

channelSubmit

@RequestMapping(value="channelSubmit")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.String> channelSubmit(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest req)
Generate a channel based on a podcast RSS feed or a YouTube URL.

Only POST operation is supported.

Parameters:
url - a podcast RSS feed or a YouTube url
user - user's unique identifier
grid - grid location, 0 - 81
category - category id
langCode - language code, en or zh.
Returns:
channel id, channel name, image url.

channelBrowse

@RequestMapping(value="channelBrowse")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.String> channelBrowse(@RequestParam(value="category",required=false)
                                                                                              java.lang.String categoryIds,
                                                                                              javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest req)
Browse all the on-air channels by category.

Parameters:
category - category id
Returns:
Category info and channels info.
First section is category info, follows channels info. Each channel is \n separated.
Category info has category id.
Channel info includes channel id, channel name, channel image url, program count, subscription count
Example:
0 success
--
1174
--
0 1207 Etsy http://s3.amazonaws.com/9x9chthumb/a.gif 2 2
0 1217 System http://s3.amazonaws.com/9x9chthumb/b.gif 1 2

categoryBrowse

@RequestMapping(value="categoryBrowse")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.String> categoryBrowse(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest req)
Browse categories.

Returns:
Categories info. Each category is \n separated.
Category info has category id, category name, channel count.

channelLineup

@RequestMapping(value="channelLineup")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.String> channelLineup(@RequestParam(value="user",required=false)
                                                                                              java.lang.String userToken,
                                                                                              @RequestParam(value="userInfo",required=false)
                                                                                              java.lang.String userInfo,
                                                                                              @RequestParam(value="channel",required=false)
                                                                                              java.lang.String channelIds,
                                                                                              javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest req)
Get all of a user's subscriptions.

Parameters:
user - user's unique identifier
userInfo - true or false. Whether to return user information as login. If asked, it will be returned after status code.
channel - channel id, can be one or multiple; example, channel=1 or channel=1,2,3
Returns:
A string of all of the user's subscribed channels' information.

Channel info has following fields:

grid id, channel id,
channel name, channel description, channel image url,
program count, type(integer, see following), status(integer, see following), contentType(integer, see following), sourceUrl

type: TYPE_GENERAL = 1; TYPE_READONLY = 2;
status: STATUS_SUCCESS = 0; STATUS_ERROR = 1;
contentType: SYSTEM_CHANNEL=1; PODCAST=2; YOUTUBE_CHANNEL=3; YOUTUBE_PLAYERLIST=4

Example:
0 success
--
1 1207 Channel1 http://hostname/images/img.jpg 3 1 0 3 http://www.youtube.com/user/android

public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.String> whatsNew(@RequestParam(value="user")

                                                                                         javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest req)
Deprecated. Get "new" program list. Current "new" definition: the latest 3 shows in a channel. 1. Latest 3 shows users haven't seen 2. Latest 3 shows watched by user, if no unseen show in this channel

Parameters:
user - user's unique identifier
Returns:
A string of new program list.
Each program is \n delimited.
Example: 1\n2\n3\n

programInfo

@RequestMapping(value="programInfo")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.String> programInfo(@RequestParam(value="channel",required=false)
                                                                                            java.lang.String channelIds,
                                                                                            @RequestParam(value="user",required=false)
                                                                                            java.lang.String userToken,
                                                                                            @RequestParam(value="userInfo",required=false)
                                                                                            java.lang.String userInfo,
                                                                                            @RequestParam(value="ipg",required=false)
                                                                                            java.lang.String ipgId,
                                                                                            javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest req)
Get program information based on query criteria.

Examples:
http://host:port/playerAPI/programInfo?channel=*&user=QQl0l208W2C4F008980F
http://host:port/playerAPI/programInfo?channel=*&ipg=13671109
http://host:port/playerAPI/programInfo?channel=153,158
http://host:port/playerAPI/programInfo?channel=153

Parameters:
channel - (1)Could be *, all the programs, e.g. channel=* (user is required for wildcard query). (2)Could be a channel Id, e.g. channel=1
(3)Could be list of channels, e.g. channels = 34,35,36.
user - user's unique identifier, it is required for wildcard query
userInfo - true or false. Whether to return user information as login. If asked, it will be returned after status code.
ipg - ipg's unique identifier, it is required for wildcard query
Returns:

Programs info. Each program is separate by \n.

Program info has:
channelId, programId, programName, description(max length=256),
programType, duration,
programThumbnailUrl, programLargeThumbnailUrl,
url1(mpeg4/slideshow), url2(webm), url3(flv more likely), url4(audio),
publish date timestamp

public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.String> saveIpg(@RequestParam(value="user",required=false)
                                                                                        java.lang.String userToken,

Save User IPG (snapshot)

Parameters:

program - program id
Returns:
A unique IPG identifier

loadIpg

@RequestMapping(value="loadIpg")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.String> loadIpg(@RequestParam(value="ipg")
                                                                                        java.lang.Long ipgId,
                                                                                        javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest req)
Load User IPG (snapshot)

Parameters:
ipg - IPG's unique identifier
Returns:
Returns a program to play follows ipg information. The program to play returns in the 2nd section, format please reference programInfo format. 3rd section is ipg information, format please reference channelLineup.

pdr

@RequestMapping(value="pdr")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.String> pdr(@RequestParam(value="user",required=false)
                                                                                    java.lang.String userToken,
                                                                                    @RequestParam(value="session",required=false)
                                                                                    java.lang.String session,
                                                                                    @RequestParam(value="pdr",required=false)
                                                                                    java.lang.String pdr,
                                                                                    javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest req)
Collecting PDR

Parameters:
user - user token
session - indicates the session when user starts using the player
pdr - pdr data

Expecting lines(separated by \n) of the following:
delta verb info
Example: delta watched 1 1 2 3
Note: first 1 is channel, the rest are program ids.
Note: each field is separated by tab.
